intro: Garciadelia leprosa, commonly known as the leprose garciadelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
